III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Financial stability
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12203
Section • (1) An agency shall demonstrate sufficient financing, on an
Description ongoing basis, to ensure the agency is carrying out its
programs and meeting the requirements for licensing. A
plan of financing must include all the following:
• (a) A listing of all income sources and the anticipated
amount of income for the current fiscal year.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are financial concerns regarding this facility.
Investigation Special Investigation was initiated by telephone with the Chief
Administrator (CA) and the Program Manager (PM) on March 27,
2024. A face-to-face onsite visit was scheduled for April 9, 2024.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via face-to-face on
April 9, 2024. He stated this was the first time he was aware of
any financial concerns with his agency. He stated he never
received any documentation from the MDHHS senior auditor
compliance monitor unit regarding the audit report for the fiscal
year ending September 30, 2023. He stated if he had received
the report and the recommendations, he would have followed the
recommendations and submitted a report to the MDHHS senior
auditor. The senior auditor's report and recommendations were
discussed with the CA. The CA reported he would provide the
report to the agency accountant for further review and compliance.
The CA stated an investigation was completed on Community
Care Organization (CCO) finances in August of 2023. The
investigation number is (2023C000569) for reference. The CA
stated there were no violations however, during that time, the
agency had excessive expenditures that were related to
recruitment/hiring expenses for new staff due to staff turnover,
utility upgrades and building improvements and the maintenance
expenses. He reported during that time the agency had a lower
census count. He stated between August of 2023 and current
April 2024, he has had a full staff and his census increased.
2

The Program Manager was interviewed via face - to - face on
April 9, 2024. She repeated the same information as the CA
regarding the MDHHS audit report and recommendations. She
added all of the agency utility bills are current, and the program is
maintaining its financial obligations. I requested to review the
agency financial revenue/expenses. The financial information I
reviewed onsite did not indicate the agency had inadequate
expenses.
Two Independent Living youth were interviewed via telephone
on April 12, 2024. Both youths reported no discomfort in the
homes where they reside. They reported they receive their
checks on a consistent basis, they eat well, and the lights and/or
water have never been turned off since their placement into the
program. The youths interviewed appeared pleased to be in the
program and reported no safety issues.
The Agency Accountant was interviewed on April 24, 2024,
via telephone. She confirmed the agency was up to date with
their monthly bills and had not missed any payments. She stated
she was working with the agency certified public accountant to pull
information together based on the recommendations of MDHHS
senior auditor report dated March 24, 2024. She reported she had
not seen the report and it was her first time seeing the
recommendations. She had no additional information.
The Certified Public Accountant was interviewed on April 29,
2024. He stated he has worked closely with the agency
accountant to show that the agency is not in a financial hardship.
He reported a copy of the agency financial assessment will be
provided of the agency finances today.
Documentation sent from the Certified Public Accountant and the
agency was reviewed on 5/3/24 and 5/14/24.
Documents reviewed:
• Current utility bills, water, light and gas dated April 9, 2024,
and May 22,2024. There were no outstanding balances.
• The certified accountant financial information dated April
29, 2024, presented the following information:
➢ Community Care Organization hired a new
accountant who will work closely with the
management team to provide thorough
financial statements, cash flow reports, and
3

monthly budget versus actual reports. This
enhanced reporting framework will support
informed decision making and enable
management to effectively monitor and
manage their financial resources.
• As of March 31, 2024, the current Statement of Activities
shows a positive net asset. This positive trend reflects the
effectiveness of management strategic initiatives and
underscores their commitment to fiscal responsibility.
• The certified accountant presented a chart prepared by the
agency accountant and the certified accountant that
included bank fees, credit card payment, insurance, lease,
loan payments, office lease, properties total, software,
supplies, utilities, taxes, payroll interest and revenue totals.
There were no concerns noted on the chart.
• The certified accountant stated moving forward, Community
Care Organization remains dedicated to improving
operational efficiency, enhancing financial management
practices, and delivering high-quality services to their
community and agency.
Analysis The financial information submitted indicated the agency had an
excess of revenue over expenses. There was no evidence
reported that the agency did not have adequate finances to
support the program services being provided. Should information
become available to indicate that financial inadequacies are
impacting the youth in care these allegations can be
reinvestigated.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
